title: Large-Scale Instructional Design Utilizing Adolescent Literature for Developing Professional Identity in Pre-Service Agricultural Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic agricultural knowledge and general understanding of secondary education environments
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environment centered on text/video content, supplemented by peer feedback and small-group activities.

learning_goals: Learners can design at least three instructional strategies applicable to agricultural education settings by analyzing adolescent literature.

Learners analyze over 3 literary texts, participate in over 2 discussions linked to agricultural education contexts, and write a professional identity statement (500 characters) as a prospective agricultural teacher.

Learners create 1 type of agriculture-literature integrated lesson material (e.g., infographics, interactive presentations) using digital tools like Canva or Adobe Spark, share it on Google Drive or Padlet, and receive feedback from over 3 peers.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
